desc: Inhibin alpha (INHA) encodes for the alpha subunit of inhibin A and B protein complex which negatively regulates FSH secretion and negatively regulates gonadal stroma cell proliferation (PMID: 3086749, 6769050, 3092356). Inhibin also regulates erythroid differentiation and placenta development (PMID: 3696240, 3299703). Inhibin has tumor suppressive functions in the gonades, as inhibin loss in gonadal tissue leads to tumor formation (PMID: 1448148). Certain single-nucleotide polymorphisms in INHA are associated with an increased risk of testicular germ cell tumors (PMID: 18413775).
